Dear Sally Jo Mouw:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 7/18/2024. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616)204-6992.
Sincerely,
Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
• The candidate the agency was planning to utilize as a supervisor, when needed,
was not qualified per the licensing rules. Technical assistance was provided
regarding the education and employment experience required as well as the
process for requesting a variance.
V. CONSULTATION
There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The agency has not yet completed any adoption or foster home licensing;
therefore, the chief administrator assessed there to be no licensing rule violations.

Financial Overview
This is a 6-month renewal for a new agency; therefore, a complete financial audit
has not yet been completed. The agency provided a budget including projected
income and expenditures as well as proof of financial stability.
Staff Interviews
The Chief Administrator who is also the adoption worker was interviewed. She
reported her main focus has been on getting the word out there that her agency
has opened and recruiting potential adoptive families.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency has adequate space and equipment to provide for the delivery of
foster care and adoption services. The agency has locking cabinets for case files
and CHRI as well as a cross shredder.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
This agency is not contracted with MDHHS to provide foster care placement or
certification services, therefore this is not applicable.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
